Transcription for 547603

norm
all
now
For who that waits so rich and free?
For who that waits so rich and free?
Till now thou cometh o'er my mind,
Come then, O beautiful crown of light,
On to the grass with the red hue,
Now all thy faith I know no more.
Now all thy faith I know no more.
I will sing of thy elderly,
And from thy home therefore I live.
And from thy home therefore I live.
O is the song thy song will,
Of clear skies, cloudy and marvellous hill,
Fallen with thy archives adorned,
In their o'er-threats happy and calm.
In their o'er-threats happy and calm.
I will sing of thy elderly,
And from thy home therefore I live.
And from thy home therefore I live.
O may this rage, this passion's grace,
This God-like miracle of love,
Fill thy whole earth with grateful praise,
And all the earth's hell inquires upon.
And all the earth's hell inquires upon.
Who is a farming God like thee?
Who has grace so rich and free?
Who is a farming God like thee?
Who is a farming God like thee?
Who has grace so rich and free?
Who has grace so rich and free?
